alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 6:40PM MDT until June 16 at 12:23PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Pend Oreille River below Albeni Falls affecting Pend Oreille and Bonner Counties. For the St. Joe River...including Calder, St Maries...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 32.5 feet, Minor flooding occurs throughout the low lying areas of the St Joe Valley. Water will be observed behind levees due to seepage. Minor flooding of the Aqua Park along the river`s edge. Outbuildings along the river that are not behind levees may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 32.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 PM PDT Wednesday was 33.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue a slow fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.5 feet on 02/20/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 545 AM PDT.
